message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.AI

The paper deals with the problem of 3D reconstruction from images, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method combines a convolutional neural network (CNN) with a Markov Random Field (MRF), which involves learning from data (cs.LG) and probabilistic graphical models (cs.AI). The MRF explicitly models the physics of perspective projection and occlusion, which is related to computer graphics (cs.GR) and robotics (cs.RO). Overall, the paper covers multiple sub-fields of computer science, but the most relevant ones are likely to be cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.RO, and cs.AI.
